Notes: Covers Silverdale site (MEL 5) (former LCC ACS residential home) and adjoingng Catherine Dalley site (former LCC care home). LCC agreed disposal as a single site in June 2017; sold 2 sites together to McCarthy & Stone in 2017. All proposed private housing for older people; currently with DV for independent viability assessment re affordable housing financial contribution. Number of TPOs restrict overall development on Silverdale side of site. PIP not propsed given site is currently pending FUL planning application and partially benefits from Local Plan allocation MEL5. Register submission altered from previous years entry to reflect enlarged site and new planning application. Site under construction. Work started, site removed from list
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
SiteNameAddress: Catherine Dalley & Silverdale, Scalford Road, Melton Mowbray

Notes: Site owned by Melton Borough Council. In MBC's small sites study and considered a strong asset for development. No plans agreed for redevelopment, MBC currently assessing development options, expext some type of progress on site over 2018-19 period to give greater certainty over redevelopment of this particular site, advise to consult with regen team when next reviewed. A small part of the site, in the south western corner is leased from the Town Estate, on a 999 year lease from April 1870.

Notes: 13/00877/OUT; Permitted with Section 106; MEL2 in allocations; Part brownfield site occupied by educational uses. Development will be supported providing the existing pre-school is relocated and would not result in the loss of the facility. Several applicatons submitted for total site area, with seperate applications submitted for conversions of existing building that are to be retained, all three applications for the site have now been permitted and groundworks commenced.Work started, site removed.
SiteNameAddress: Site of former King Edward VII School site, Burton Road, Melton Mowbray

Notes: Site been actively persued by landowner Worthearly Ltd, plans at an advanced stage of development. Formal pre app advice provided over 2018, inc design review and public consultation. May be issues with current tenant, relocation and impacts of noise from retained neighbouring industrial uses on new dwellings . May be issues in terms of developer ambitions to access Homes England funding to support their shared ownership product (HEYLO housing) and affordable housing contributions to MBC. also control parcel of land opposite allocation (staircase factory). Jeld Wen major local employer and development partially dependant on them moving site operations to suitable new premises locally.
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
